General portal related errors Portal related errors can occur when registering devices, profiles and apps using the Knox Configure admin console. Possible system errors could occur as a result of the following: Invalid file formats, exceeding the maximum file size, invalid/missing entries, or invalid URLs. Code Cause of Error Troubleshoot 4000013 The CSV file header is invalid. Ensure the CSV file header uploading doesn't have any forbidden characters. Try the following: In Knox Configure, go to Actions > Upload devices. Under the Device list file field, click Download sample CSV file. Enter your device information in the sample file with the default headings. Save and try uploading the CSV file again. 4000014 The CSV file is empty. Ensure the CSV file uploading is not empty. 4000414 The EULA is invalid. A system error occurred. Refresh the page and load the EULA again. If the problem persists, contact Samsung. 4002009 EULA is already agreed to. The end user has already accepted the End User License Agreement (EULA). Do not prompt users to accept the EULA again. Failed to upload file. A system error occurred. Try to upload the file again. If the problem persists, contact Samsung. An app with this name already exists. Ensure the name of the app you are uploading does not already exist in Knox Configure. Re-name the app if necessary. Invalid APK version name. Invalid APK version name. Please change the version name and try uploading again. 4090001 File too large. Max 4000 devices allowed per upload. Try splitting the device upload list to reduce the size of .csv you are uploading. Note that there is a max of 4000 devices allowed per upload. 4150000 File type is not supported. The file you are trying to upload is not supported. Knox Configure only accepts .csv files. App name cannot contain special characters. Rename the app so it does not contain any special or forbidden characters. App version is invalid. An app you are trying to upload is invalid. Verify that the version you're attempting to upload is correct. Try to re-upload the app again. CSV file is required. A system error occurred. Verify that you've attached a .csv file, try to re-attach the .csv and upload it again. If the problem persists, contact Samsung. 4040105 No CAPTCHA code entered. No CAPTCHA code was entered. Carefully enter the CAPTCHA code and submit. 4004001 The email agreeing to the Customer Terms is invalid. Verify the email entered is correct, refresh the page and try again. 4000113 The CAPTCHA code is incorrect. The CAPTCHA code is incorrect. Carefully re-enter the CAPTCHA code again and submit. 4042006 The tag already exists. A system error occurred. The profile tag entered is a duplicate, enter a different tag. If the problem persists, contact Samsung. 40001 The URL is not valid. Verify the URL entered is correct, refresh the page and try again. If the problem persists, contact Samsung. 4043 The activation status of the client is invalid. A system error occurred. If the problem persists, contact Samsung. Device related errors Device related portal errors can occur when registering devices using the Knox Configure admin console. Possible system errors could occur as a result of invalid or duplicate devices in the CSV file, invalid IMEIs/SNs, duplicate device uploads and unverified device uploads. Code Cause of Error Troubleshoot 0 Failed to register device. A system error occurred. Try to register the devices again. If the problem persists, contact Samsung. 4042000 The device(s) could not be found. A system error occurred. Try to re-upload the devices again. If the problem persists, contact Samsung. 4041401 The device was not found. A system error occurred. Try to register the devices again. If the problem persists, contact Samsung 4002004 Invalid or duplicate devices detected. Check the IMEI and SN of the devices you are uploading. Ensure they are correct and there are no device duplicates already in the system. 4002003 Invalid or duplicate devices in uploaded CSV file. Check the IMEI and SN of the devices in the .csv you are uploading. Ensure they are correct and there are no device duplicates already in the system. Verify the format in the uploaded CSV file. 4012000 Incorrect IMEI/serial number. Check the IMEI and SN of the devices you are uploading. Ensure they are correct and there are no device duplicates already in the system. 4000307 These devices are already registered. The device you are trying to upload already exists in the system. Ensure the device is using the correct IMEI / SN. Re-upload the device if necessary. Try the following: Open Knox Configure and go to the Devices tab. Select all devices and go to Actions > Export to CSV. Open the CSV you just downloaded and the CSV that you tried to upload. Device IDs found on both spreadsheets indicate that you have tried to upload devices already in Knox Configure. Remove the duplicate devices and try uploading your CSV again. 4002000 Some devices are invalid. One or more devices in the device list you're trying to upload is invalid. Ensure the device is using the correct IMEI / SN. Re-upload if necessary. 4003004 These devices are already registered. The device you are trying to upload already exists in the system. Ensure the device is using the correct IMEI / SN by doing the following: On the device, tap the Settings icon. Tap About phone. Re-upload if necessary. 4003005 These devices are already verified. The device you are trying to upload is already verified in the system. Ensure the device is using the correct IMEI / SN by doing the following: On the device, tap the Settings icon. Tap About phone. 4040300 The device was not found. A system error occurred, the device cannot be found. Refresh the page and try to select it again. If the problem persists, contact Samsung. 400001 The application already exists. A system error occurred. The uploaded app already exists in the system. If it does not exist, and the problem persists, contact Samsung. 400001 The application is invalid. Please check the integrity of the uploaded .apk file. 2002024 All uploaded devices are invalid A device you are trying to upload is invalid. Ensure the device is using the correct IMEI / SN by doing the following: On the device, tap the Settings icon. Tap About phone. Re-upload if necessary. 4003002 Duplicate devices exist in the uploaded CSV file. Remove duplicate devices in the .csv file and re-upload it. 4010000 Subsidiary not found. A system error occurred. Refresh the page and re-enroll the device. If the problem persists, contact Samsung. 4042108 The devices in the sales record are not only uploaded by the SA. A system error occurred. Refresh the page and try again. If the problem persists, contact Samsung. 4042104 Application not found. A system error occurred. Refresh the page and try again. If the problem persists, contact Samsung. 4000308 The device is in an invalid state. The device cannot be enrolled because it has not yet been verified. Try the following: In the Knox Configure Portal and click Devices to view the Status of the device experiencing the error. If the device is not in a Ready for Customization state, it cannot be enrolled in Knox Configure until it is validated. Ensure you have submitted the correct Proof of purchase information to verify device ownership. After submitting proof of purchase, it will take several business days before a Samsung Admin can verify your information against the Purchase Order provided by your reseller.If the problem persists, contact Samsung. Profile / user errors Profile or user errors can occur when the profile content is duplicated, unregistered, or has improper device configurations on the Knox Configure admin console. Other possible causes could be invalid source URLs, invalid permissions, and compatibility issues. Code Cause of Error Troubleshoot 4000413 The profile content is duplicated. A system error occurred. Refresh the page and try again. If the problem persists, contact Samsung. 4002007 The maximum profile size limit has been reached. Your profile has exceeded 300 MB. Try compressing or removing the image and sound files and try saving the profile again. Otherwise, contact Samsung to increase the profile size capacity. 4042005 The profile snapshot could not be found. A system error occurred. Refresh the page and try again. If the problem persists, contact Samsung. 4045400 The profile schema could not be found. A system error occurred. Refresh the page and try again. If the problem persists, contact Samsung. 4042002 The uploaded devices could not be found. A system error occurred. If the problem persists, contact Samsung. 4044 Tenant is not registered. A system error occurred. Refresh the page and try again. If the problem persists, contact Samsung. 4090900 The user tenant already exists. A system error occurred. Refresh the page and try again. If the problem persists, contact Samsung. 4040900 The user tenant was not found. A system error occurred. Refresh the page and try again. If the problem persists, contact Samsung. 4090100 This user already exists. The queried user is already invited and does not need to be invited again. 4000000 This resource is invalid. A system error occurred. Refresh the page and try again. If the problem persists, contact Samsung. 4040400 The profile could not be found. A system error occurred. Refresh the page and try again. If the problem persists, contact Samsung. 4000400 A profile with this name already exists. When cloning a profile, it retains the same name. Check your cloned profiles and change any duplicate names. 4000400 The profile is invalid. A system error occurred. If the problem persists, contact Samsung. 4030100 User didn't have permission to invite admins. Check your user profile permissions. The user needs to be granted invite permissions. 4005003 Can't find account of invited user. The user you have invited doesn't have a Knox Partner account. Validate whether the invited user is correct. 4040900 Primary user's tenant not found. A system error occurred. Refresh the page and try again. If the problem persists, contact Samsung. 4040100 Primary user's information not found. A system error occurred. Refresh the page and try again. If the problem persists, contact Samsung. 4030100 Primary user does not have permission to invite admins. A system error occurred. Refresh the page and try again. If the problem persists, contact Samsung. 4010000 Subsidiary not found. A system error occurred. Refresh the page and try again. If the problem persists, contact Samsung. 4004004 Invalid source URL. A system error occurred. Refresh the page and try again. If the problem persists, contact Samsung. 4005005 The user is already invited in Knox Configure within this company. User is already invited. Please invite other user. 4012001 The user is not a subsidiary administrator. Check if the user you are trying to add is a subsidiary administrator. 4003001 Please assign devices to resend the Customer Terms Agreement email. You need to assign devices to resend the Customer Terms Agreement email. Profile Name cannot be duplicated. Please try again with different Profile Name Try again with a different Profile Name. User already has the profile The user already has a profile. Try again with a different user. 4003003 The device is assigned with a different tenant or has a different profile assigned. Select a device not assigned a tenant or profile. 4005004 Tenant information of invited user and primary user are not matched. A system error occurred. If the problem persists, contact Samsung. 4003006 The selected partner is already assigned with another Samsung subsidiary administrator. Select a partner who did is not assigned with another Samsung subsidiary administrator. 4003007 The selected partner's country does not exist in the Samsung subsidiary administrator's country list. Select a partner whose country exists in the Samsung subsidiary administrator's approved country list. 4003008 The selected partner is already assigned with this Samsung subsidiary administrator. Select a partner who is not assigned this Samsung subsidiary administrator. 4040100 Reseller not found. A system error occurred. Refresh the page and try again. If the problem persists, contact Samsung. 4000102 Reseller email address is empty. A system error occurred. Refresh the page and try again. If the problem persists, contact Samsung. 4040100 Customer not found. A system error occurred. Refresh the page and try again. If the problem persists, contact Samsung. 4000102 Customer email address is empty. A system error occurred. Refresh the page and try again. If the problem persists, contact Samsung. 4000114 Status of customer is not Active. A system error occurred. Refresh the page and try again. If the problem persists, contact Samsung. 4000114 Status of customer is not Blocked. A system error occurred. Refresh the page and try again. If the problem persists, contact Samsung. 4000114 Status of customer is not Pending. A system error occurred. Refresh the page and try again. If the problem persists, contact Samsung. 4000114 Status of reseller is not Pending. A system error occurred. Refresh the page and try again. If the problem persists, contact Samsung. 4042104 Customer not found. A system error occurred. Refresh the page and try again. If the problem persists, contact Samsung 4042107 Customer is already added for a reseller. The customer is already added to the reseller. Please try adding a different customer. 4042106 Device push type or push registration ID is not available. A system error occurred. Refresh the page and try again. If the problem persists, contact Samsung. 4005002 InviteID is not found. A system error occurred. Refresh the page and try again. If the problem persists, contact Samsung. 4005001 Invite state is already confirmed. Verify whether the state is confirmed. 4000418 Update app version failure. Application version was not updated successfully. Verify that the target application version is compatible with the existing application version. 4000403 Update profile version failure. Profile version was not updated successfully. Verify that the target profile version is compatible with the existing profile version. License errors Knox Configure console license errors can occur for a variety of reasons, including: expired license, terminated licenses, or Samsung License server connection issues. Code Cause of Error Troubleshoot 4000 Invalid license key. The license key is invalid. Ensure you are entering a valid license key. Sign in to the Knox Partner Portal and see Knox licenses for more information. If you continue to experience issues, obtain and use different licence key and re-launch Knox Configure. 4001 The license is not activated. The license key is not activated. Activate the licence and re-launch the Knox Configure. 4002 The license ID is null. The license key ID is empty. Sign in to the Knox Partner Portal and see Knox licenses for more information. If you continue to experience issues, obtain and use different licence key and re-launch Knox Configure. 4004 The specified license is not allowed to be registered in Knox Configure. Check the product type of the license. Ensure you are entering a Knox License Management (KLM) key. Obtain and use different licence key and re-launch Knox Configure. Failed to add license (%s). A system error occurred. Try to add the license again. If the problem persists, contact Samsung. 4092001 Failed to update license (%s). A system error occurred. Try to update the license again. If the problem persists, contact Samsung. 4221 The license is already registered. The license key has already been activated. Obtain and use a different licence key and re-launch Knox Configure. To purchase new licenses, contact knoxcustom@samsung.com. 4002008 The device count has exceeded the license quantity You do not have enough licenses to enroll all of your devices. Go to the License tab and check your total license count and the number of licenses already activated. If the problem persists, contact Samsung. 4003000 The license in the profile has expired. The license key associated with the profile has expired. If you are using a trial key generated from the Knox Partner Portal, you can check your expiration date. Sign in to Knox Partner Portal and see Knox licenses for more information. 4042007 The license assigned to this profile could not be found. A license was removed from Knox Configure during the device enrollment process. Try the following: In the Knox Configure console, go to Licenses > Actions > Upload licenses. Add a License name and enter the new License key. Click Upload. 4041 The license ID is invalid. A system error occurred. Refresh the page and try again. If the problem persists, contact Samsung. 4000412 The license in the profile is duplicated. The license key you are trying to enter has already been uploaded to Knox Configure. You do not have to upload the license key every time you create a new profile. Once you have uploaded a license key, you can assign the license to all profiles. If the problem persists, contact Samsung. Other errors Code Cause of Error Troubleshoot 4000107 QMG name already exists. A file with the same name already exists. 4040301 Media not found Media asset not found 4000201 Null icon file Invalid APK: Icon file missing 4000202 Null manifest xml Invalid APK: Manifest xml is missing 4000203 Invalid app certificate The application certificate is invalid 4000204 Signing issue APK not signed or signed incorrectly 4000205 App signature mismatch Signature of uploaded APK does not match existing signature 4000101 App error uploading file Error encountered when uploading file 4000102 App binary exists This application already exists 4000114 Package info not match Mismatch in current and new application package information 4000001 Cannot delete app version App only has one version and version is being deleted. Use delete app within Actions menu instead. 4000002 App version used in profile App version cannot be deleted, as its still used in profile. 4000003 App version still in signing status App version cannot be deleted, as its still in signing status. 4040001 App not found Application not found. 4002001 Failed to update the request A system error occurred. Refresh the page and try again. If the problem persists, contact Samsung. 5000000 Internal server error. A system error occurred. Refresh the page and try again. If the problem persists, contact Samsung. 5002001 Failed to send request to API Gateway. A system error occurred. Refresh the page and try again. If the problem persists, contact Samsung. 4042001 The request could not be found. A system error occurred. Refresh the page and try again. If the problem persists, contact Samsung. 4002002 The request state is invalid. A system error occurred. Refresh the page and try again. If the problem persists, contact Samsung. 4002001 Failed to update the request. A system error occurred. Refresh the page and try again. If the problem persists, contact Samsung. Action failed. A system error occurred. Refresh the page and try again. If the problem persists, contact Samsung. 4000000 This resource is invalid. A system error occurred. Refresh the page and try again. If the problem persists, contact Samsung. 4003 The method argument not valid. A system error occurred. Refresh the page and try again. If the problem persists, contact Samsung. 4001905 Server busy. Please try again in a few seconds. A system error occurred. Refresh the page and try again. If the problem persists, contact Samsung. 4042 The client ID is invalid. A system error occurred. Refresh the page and try again. If the problem persists, contact Samsung. 4010102 Please fill in the OTP Code to login outside of the Samsung network. Please fill in the OTP Code to login outside of the Samsung network. 40005 Google Play services are temporarily unavailable. A system error occurred. Refresh the page and try again. If the problem persists, contact Samsung. 4042106 Device push type or push registration ID not available. A system error occurred. Refresh the page and try again. If the problem persists, contact Samsung. 4042105 Content not found. A system error occurred. Refresh the page and try again. If the problem persists, contact Samsung. 4042102 Sellout not found. A system error occurred. Refresh the page and try again. If the problem persists, contact Samsung. Action failed. A system error occurred. Refresh the page and try again. If the problem persists, contact Samsung. Connection to Google Playstore timed out. A system error occurred. Refresh the page and try again. If the problem persists, contact Samsung. Connection to Google Playstore error. A system error occurred. Refresh the page and try again. If the problem persists, contact Samsung. 4040000 Required parameters missing. Verify that you've entered the mandatory parameters. If you continue to experience issues, a system error may have occurred. Refresh the page and try again. If the problem persists, contact Samsung.

sections.title: Warning messages
sections.content: Warning messages. You may encounter the following warning messages when using the Knox Configure admin console, this section of the guide provides troubleshooting tips for these messages. Code Warning message Cause of Error Troubleshoot 91001 Warning: Unable to create shortcut for <package name1>, <package name2> as application(s) is/are not installed. Check the package name(s) in your profile. Unable to create a shortcut for the specified app. The package name wasn't found. Verify that the app had been successfully installed.If you continue to experience issues, check the package name(s) in your profile and verify that the package name has been entered correctly. 91002 Warning: Unable to change application icon(s) for <package name1>, <package name2> as application(s) is/are not installed. Check the package name(s) in your profile. Can't change the app icon for the specified app. The package name wasn't found. Verify that the app had been successfully installed.If you continue to experience issues, check the package name(s) in your profile and verify that the package name has been entered correctly. 91003 Warning: Unable to change application name(s) for <package name1>, <package name2> as application(s) is/are not installed. Check the package name(s) in your profile. Can't change the specified app name. The package name wasn't found. Verify that the app had been successfully installed.If you continue to experience issues, check the package name(s) in your profile and verify that the package name has been entered correctly. 91004 Warning: Unable to disable application(s) for <package name1>, <package name2> as application(s) is/are not installed. Check the package name(s) in your profile. Can't disable the specified app. The package name wasn't found. Verify that the app had been successfully installed. If you continue to experience issues, check the package name(s) in your profile and verify that the package name has been entered correctly. 91005 Warning: Unable to prevent application(s) for <package name1>, <package name2> from being uninstalled as the application is not installed. Check the package name(s) in your profile. Unable to prevent the specified app from being uninstalled. The package name wasn't found. Verify that the app had been successfully installed. If you continue to experience issues, check the package name(s) in your profile and verify that the package name has been entered correctly. 91006 Warning: Unable to allow appear on top for<package name1>, <package name2> as application(s) is/are not installed. Check the package name(s) in your profile. Unable to add an "appear on top" permission for the specified app. The package name wasn't found. Verify that the app had been successfully installed. If you continue to experience issues, check the package name(s) in your profile and verify that the package name has been entered correctly. 91007 Warning: Unable to allow access data usage for <package name1>, <package name2> as application(s) is/are not installed. Check the package name(s) in your profile. Unable to add a "Usage data access" permission for the specified app.The package name wasn't found. Verify that the app had been successfully installed.If you continue to experience issues, check the package name(s) in your profile and verify that the package name has been entered correctly. 91008 Warning: Unable to allow changing system setting for <package name1>, <package name2> as application(s) is/are not installed. Check the package name(s) in your profile. Unable to add a "Change system setting" permission for the specified app. The package name wasn't found. Verify that the app had been successfully installed. If you continue to experience issues, check the package name(s) in your profile and verify that the package name has been entered correctly. 91009 Warning: Unable to restrict application(s) to doze mode for <package name1>, <package name2> as application(s) is/are not installed. Check the package name(s) in your profile. Unable to add a "Application to prevent doze" permission for the specified app.The package name wasn't found. Verify that the app had been successfully installed.If you continue to experience issues, check the package name(s) in your profile and verify that the package name has been entered correctly. 91010 Warning: Unable to add dex application shortcut(s) for <package name1>, <package name2> as application(s) is/are not installed. Check the package name(s) in your profile. Unable to create a DeX shortcut for the specified app. The package name wasn't found. Verify that the app had been successfully installed. If you continue to experience issues, check the package name(s) in your profile and verify that the package name has been entered correctly. 91011 Warning: Unable to disable dex application for <package name1>, <package name2> as application(s) is/are not installed. Check the package name(s) in your profile. Can't disable the specified DeX app. The package name wasn't found Verify that the app had been successfully installed. If you continue to experience issues, check the package name(s) in your profile and verify that the package name has been entered correctly. 91012 Warning: Unable to remap hardware keys for <package name1>, <package name2> as application(s) is/are not installed. Check the package name(s) in your profile. Unable to remap hardware keys for the specified app. The package name wasn't found. Verify that the app has been successfully installed. If you continue to experience issues, check the package name(s) and component name in your profile and verify that the names have been entered correctly. 91016 Warning: Unable to launch application(s) for <package name1>, <package name2> as application(s) is/are not installed. Check the package name(s) in your profile. Unable to launch the specified app. The package name is not installed. Verify that the app is successfully installed. If you continue to experience issues, check the package name(s) in your KC profile and verify that the package name is entered correctly. 92001 Warning: Unable to create shortcut(s) for <package name1>, <package name2> as application(s) is/are in disabled mode. Check the package name(s) in your profile. Can't disable the specified app. The app has been disabled. Verify that the app hasn't been disabled. If the app has been disabled, the app must be enabled before a shortcut can be added. 92002 Warning: Unable to change application icon(s) for <package name1>, <package name2> as application(s) is/are in disabled mode. Check the package name(s) in your profile. Can't change the app icon for the specified app.The app has been disabled. Verify that the app hasn't been disabled. If the app has been disabled, the app must be enabled before the app icon can be modified. 92003 Warning: Unable to change application name(s) for <package name1>, <package name2> as the application(s) is/are in disbled mode. Check the package name(s) in your profile. Can't change the specified app name.The app has been disabled. Verify that the app hasn't been disabled. If the app has been disabled, the app must be enabled before the app name can be modified. 92004 Warning: Unable to restrict application(s) in doze mode for <package name1>, <package name2> as the application(s) is/are in disbled mode. Check the package name(s) in your profile. Unable to add a "Application to prevent doze" permission for the specified app.The app has been disabled. Verify that the app hasn't been disabled. If the app has been disabled, the app must be enabled before app permissions can be modified. 92005 Warning: Unable to add dex shortcut application(s) for <package name1>, <package name2> as the application(s) is/are in disbled mode. Check the package name(s) in your profile. Unable to create a DeX shortcut for the specified app. The package name has been disabled. Verify that the app hasn't been disabled. If the app has been disabled, the app must be enabled before creating a shortcut. 92006 Warning: Unable to disable dex application(s) for <package name1>, <package name2> as the application(s) is/are in disabled mode. Check the package name(s) in your profile. Unable to disable the specified DeX app. The package name has already been disabled. Verify that the app hasn't already been disabled. 92012 Warning: Unable to launch application(s) for <package name1>, <package name2> as application(s) is/are disabled. Check the package name(s) in your profile. Unable to launch the specified app. The package name is disabled. Verify that the app had been successfully installed and enabled. If you continue to experience issues, check the package name(s) in your profile and verify that the package name has been entered correctly. 93100 Warning: Unable to disable OMC mode as OMC functionality is not supported in the target device. Check the device and your profile. Can't disable Open Market Customization (OMC) mode. The target device doesn't support this functionality. OMC mode must be supported on the target device before modifying the OMC settings. Check the device profile to verify compatibility. 93200 Warning: Unable to enable SIM lock as SIM card functionality is not supported in the target device. Check the device and/or your profile. Can't enable SIM lock. The target device doesn't support this functionality. SIM lock must be supported on the target device before modifying the SIM lock settings. Check the device profile to verify compatibility. 93201 Warning: Unable to enable SIM 1 lock as SIM card is not inserted to SIM 1 slot in the target device. Check the device. Can't enable SIM lock on the SIM 1 slot. The target device doesn't have a SIM card inserted on the SIM 1 slot. Verify that a SIM card has been inserted on the SIM 1 slot before enabling SIM lock. 93202 Warning: Unable to enable SIM 2 lock as dual SIM card functionality is not supported in the target device. Check the device and/or your profile. Can't enable SIM lock on the SIM 2 slot. The target device doesn't have the dual SIM feature. SIM lock on the SIM 2 slot is only supported on devices with the dual SIM feature. Check the target device for compatibility. 93203 Warning: Unable to enable SIM 2 lock as SIM card is not inserted to SIM 2 slot in the target device. Check the device. Can't enable SIM lock on the SIM 2 slot. The target device doesn't have a SIM card inserted on the SIM 2 slot. If the device has the Dual SIM feature, verify that a SIM card has been inserted on the SIM 2 slot before enabling SIM lock. 93300 Warning: Unable to disable NFC as NFC feature is not supported in the target device. Check the device and/or your profile. Can't enable NFC. The target device doesn't support NFC. NFC can only be enabled on supported devices. Check the target device for compatibility. 93301 Warning: Unable to change NFC setting as NFC feature is not supported in the target device. Check the device and/or your profile. Can't modify NFC settings. The target device doesn't support NFC. NFC can only be modified on supported devices. Check the target device for compatibility. 93302 Warning: Unable to prevent from changing NFC setting as NFC feature is not supported in the target device. Check the device and/or your profile. Can't prevent change settings for NFC. The target device doesn't support NFC. You can only prevent the settings from being modified for devices that support NFC. Check the target device for compatibility. 93303 Warning: Unable to set ringtone as feature is not supported in the target device. Check the device and/or your profile. Can't set the ringtone on the device. The target device doesn't support the ringtone feature. You can only set the ringtone for devices that support this feature. Check the target device for compatibility. 93312 Warning: Unable to enable battery protection as feature is not supported in the target device. Check the device and/or your profile. The battery setting is not supported on this device. Check that you are on the correct device. This feature will work for tablets, Galaxy XCover Pro/XCover5 with R OS only, and phones from S OS. 93325 Warning: Unable to open files <file title1>, <file title2>, ... because there is no available application that can open them. The WebKiosk app is not available on the device. Install or enable at least one (1) app capable of opening the target file on the device. 94400 Warning: Unable to create shortcut(s) for <package name1\activity name1>, <package name1\activity name2>, <package name2\activity name1> as activity of application(s) is/are not present. Check the activity name(s) in your profile. Unable to add shortcut for the specified activity. The application activity wasn't found. Verify that the app had been successfully installed.If you continue to experience issues, check the package name(s) and activity name in your profile and verify that the names has been entered correctly. 94401 Warning: Unable to disable <package name1\component name 1>, <package name1\component name 2>, <package name2\component name3> as activity/component of application(s) is/are not present. Check the activity name(s) in your profile. Can't disable an invalid activity/component. The <package name1\component name1> wasn't found. Verify that the app had been successfully installed.If you continue to experience issues, check the package name(s) and component name in your profile and verify that the names has been entered correctly. 94401 Warning: Unable to disable pre-installed browsers for <package name1>, <package name2>, ... as the application(s) may be disabled by some other application. Unable to disable pre-installed browsers. The package is disabled by another app. Check disabled features in other management apps such as Family Link parent app. 95002 Warning: Unable to add application URL restrictions for <package name1>, <package name2>, ... as the application(s) may be disabled by some other application. Unable to add URL restrictions. The package is disabled by another app. Check disabled features in other management apps such as Family Link parent app.

sections.title: What is the purpose of Knox Configure?
sections.content: What is the purpose of Knox Configure?. Knox Configure is a cloud-based solution for customizing and staging Samsung devices remotely, right out of the box. It helps service and content providers rebrand and customize Samsung devices with a frictionless, out-of-the-box setup process. Advanced device configuration enables them to tailor every granular aspect to their specific needs and to transform devices into purpose-built appliances. For a comprehensive list of features, see Knox features on Android.

sections.title: What editions of Knox Configure are available?
sections.content: What editions of Knox Configure are available?. Two Knox Configure editions are available: Setup edition is designed for a one-time deployment of apps and settings to enrolled devices without incremental updates. Within the license period, all settings remain even after a factory reset. Dynamic edition is designed to deploy and update enrolled device policies as many times as needed without a factory reset. It includes all the policies and settings available in the setup edition as well as other enhancements such as Single/Multi ProKiosk mode, Profile push updates, and Unlimited app installation.

sections.title: Which platforms, operating systems, and devices does Knox Configure support? Which specific versions does it support?
sections.content: Which platforms, operating systems, and devices does Knox Configure support? Which specific versions does it support?. Knox Configure is supported on Samsung devices running Knox versions 3.0 and higher, and running Android 8 and higher. Each Knox solution, including Knox Configure, supports the five most recent major Android versions. That is, the most recent version plus the four previous versions.

sections.title: What's included in my 90-day free trial?
sections.content: What's included in my 90-day free trial?. Your trial includes the full, unrestricted features of Knox Configure. You can set up your Knox Configure account, create and customize profiles, and assign the profiles to your devices. The trial license is valid for 90 days with a maximum of 30 devices for either the Setup or Dynamic edition.

sections.title: Can I switch my trial to a paid subscription without losing my settings and data?
sections.content: Can I switch my trial to a paid subscription without losing my settings and data?. Yes. When a trial license is switched to a commercial one, the customer tenant is not changed. The existing configuration data remains on the tenant that you created during your free trial. Therefore, the only thing you need to do is keep using the Knox Configure portal. You can manage more devices over a longer period of time, and use as many commercial licenses as needed without having to conduct any backups or transfer any data or settings. To upgrade your trial license, consult your Knox reseller.

sections.title: Which types of companies are best suited to use Knox Configure?
sections.content: Which types of companies are best suited to use Knox Configure?. Knox Configure is intended for publishers and media service providers, as well as telecom operators that are looking for ways to launch target segment-specific phones or tablets. This service helps them ensure that each of their brands, as well as the desired user experience, can be applied to end-user devices by remotely configuring the devices. Configure devices to fit your specific needs with no development or unboxing required.

sections.title: Will end users be able to unlink Samsung devices from Knox Configure after enrollment?
sections.content: Will end users be able to unlink Samsung devices from Knox Configure after enrollment?. No. Even if end users try factory resetting their devices, Knox Configure will trigger to perform the setup configuration again with the assigned profiles. Once the license expires, Knox Configure revokes the policies and stops deploying profiles to the devices.

sections.title: Does Samsung customize booting/shutdown animations and wallpapers for customers?
sections.content: Does Samsung customize booting/shutdown animations and wallpapers for customers?. No. Booting or shutdown animations, wallpapers, and lock screen customizations are added by customers. See Create a custom animation file to learn how to make and upload customized graphics on the Knox Configure console.

sections.title: Can I get support from Samsung for any issues and questions that might arise while using Knox Configure?
sections.content: Can I get support from Samsung for any issues and questions that might arise while using Knox Configure?. To address issues you might encounter while using Knox Configure, explore the admin guide for Device-side errors and Portal-side errors. Also, explore the KBAs for up-to-date resolutions to known issues. For issues that can't be solved by using our online resources, you can sign up on SamsungKnox.com to send us inquiries or create support tickets. See Get support to learn how to create a support ticket.

sections.title: What's a KDP Reseller?
sections.content: What's a KDP Reseller?. The term _KDP_ stands for the Knox Deployment Program, which enables trusted Samsung device resellers to register devices for their enterprise customers. If you purchase devices from one of these resellers, you can then use Knox Configure (KC) to customize devices for your enterprise needs. Only devices purchased from participating resellers can be verified and uploaded to KC through the program.

sections.title: What is a KDP Reseller?
sections.content: What is a KDP Reseller?. The term _KDP_ stands for the Knox Deployment Program, which enables trusted Samsung device resellers to register devices for their enterprise customers. If you purchase devices from one of these resellers, you can then use Knox Configure (KC) and Knox Mobile Enrollment (KME) to customize devices for your enterprise needs. Only devices purchased from participating resellers can be verified and uploaded to KC or KME through the program.

sections.title: Unable to reassign devices to a renewed license
sections.content: Unable to reassign devices to a renewed license. IT Admins might encounter an error when assigning devices previously activated on a license. Learn about how to resolve the issue. If you renew a Knox Configure Dynamic Edition Per Device license after the 30 day grace period, you may encounter the following error when attempting to reassign devices that were previously activated on the license: > Failed to assign devices > Could not assign profile _profile name_ to device(s). Please see details for errors. If the problem persists, contact Samsung Knox Support. When downloading the details, the following description is shown: > Failed to assign devices Cause For fleets with 1000 or more devices, there's an issue with the logic that checks if there are enough assignments left on the license. Resolution First, ensure that the device was previously activated on the license before the license expired: 1. On the Knox Admin Portal, go to Licenses. 2. Click Manage license keys. 3. Click Device Status. 4. Enter your Knox license key and device IMEIs associated with that license. 5. Click CHECK STATUS. If the devices were previously activated on the license, they can be reassigned. Devices must be assigned in bulk to the correct profile in batches of 1000 or less. Additional information For more information about how to manage Knox Configure licenses, refer to Manage licenses.

sections.title: Updates to device search from 23.09
sections.content: Updates to device search from 23.09. Starting with Knox Configure 23.09, the device search functionality has changed. Learn more about how to query the device list. Starting with Knox Configure 23.09, users are no longer able to search for devices by the following attributes: Profile, User ID, Model, Tags, Order number You can now only search for devices by IMEI/MEID, serial number, or custom ID. In addition, the search term must be an exact match. For example, searching for a custom ID of NewDevice would return NewDevice but not MyNewDevice or NewDeviceID. This change was made to improve the performance of the device search. The Samsung Knox Configure team is currently working to further improve the functionality of the device search. Workaround To perform advanced searches on the device list, download the list and filter the resulting CSV file.

sections.title: How long does it take to upload devices in the Knox Configure portal?
sections.content: How long does it take to upload devices in the Knox Configure portal?. Depending on the number of devices in your list, uploading them may take a few seconds to a few minutes. When complete, a status bar will show the results of each device upload: Upload devices, Valid devices, Invalid devices, Duplicate devices If there are any errors associated with these devices, click Details to view the Activity log.

sections.title: What's the difference between the delete and bulk delete actions?
sections.content: What's the difference between the delete and bulk delete actions?. The Delete button allows you to select devices listed in the Reseller Portal and delete them from Knox Configure. The Bulk delete button allows you to upload CSV files listing multiple device IDs that you can delete at the same time.

sections.title: Why do I get an error message when I try to add an admin to my Knox Configure tenant?
sections.content: Why do I get an error message when I try to add an admin to my Knox Configure tenant?. You might be experiencing an error because the admin you are inviting already has a SamsungKnox.com account. Please contact Samsung Knox Support for more information. Only Tenant Admins can manage and add other admins to Knox Configure. The Tenant Admin is the person who set up Knox Configure account for the enterprise. To learn more about administrator roles, see Administrators.

sections.title: Will customers receive an email when resellers upload devices on their behalf?
sections.content: Will customers receive an email when resellers upload devices on their behalf?. Yes, customers receive an email when resellers upload devices for them.

sections.title: Can I filter Activity logs by Upload ID?
sections.content: Can I filter Activity logs by Upload ID?. No. Currently, you can only sort device data by Upload ID.

sections.title: Do I have to specify whether I am uploading devices for Knox Configure or Knox Mobile Enrollment?
sections.content: Do I have to specify whether I am uploading devices for Knox Configure or Knox Mobile Enrollment?. No, after you upload devices for a customer, they determine whether to enroll those devices in Knox Mobile Enrolment, Knox Configure, or both.

sections.title: Knox Configure: Experience app
sections.content: Knox Configure: Experience app. Download the Knox Configure Experience virtual demo app for your smartphone or tablet to highlight the value proposition and customer benefits of Knox Configure. For smartphone (102 MB), For tablet (126 MB) _*"Knox Configure Experience app is optimized for devices with a screen resolution of WUXGA/FHD (2K) or higher (Galaxy Note 8, Tab S3, etc). The app may not work properly on devices with a screen resolution of WXGA or lower (Galaxy J Series, Tab A 8", Tab E, Tab Active 2, etc)._

sections.title: Where are the Knox Configure servers hosted?
sections.content: Where are the Knox Configure servers hosted?. Knox Configure is hosted by Amazon Web Services (AWS) in the US (for North/Central/South America and Caribbean) and Ireland (for the rest of world except China).

sections.title: How to decrease profile size in Knox Configure
sections.content: How to decrease profile size in Knox Configure. When creating or modifying a profile in Knox Configure (KC), you may encounter a 4002007 error: Your profile has exceeded 300 MB. Try compressing or removing the image and sound files and try saving the profile again. Otherwise, contact Samsung to increase the profile size capacity. Cause The default maximum profile size in Knox Configure is 300 MB. Profiles exceeding this limit may contain large images, sound files, document files, or uploaded applications. Resolution You can reduce the size of the public or internal applications in your profile to ensure your profile size is under the 300 MB limit: #For public applications: On the Add Applications and Widgets screen, instead of directly uploading the APK file to the KC profile with Upload Application, add the application using the Add from Google Play option. The Google Play store will need to be enabled for the applications to be able to be installed using this option. However, if you want to prevent end users from installing all other applications, you can whitelist specific applications to have the permission to be installed using the Installation allowlist feature under the Applications & Content page of your KC profile. Only the applications specified in this allowlist will be able to be installed on the device. Other applications will not be able to be installed even though Google Play is accessible. #For internal applications: If you want to install apps on your device from other trusted sources (i.e. FTP servers, company email), you can add bookmarks that link to these internal sources. Include these applications in the allowlist to ensure only trusted applications can be installed. Additional information , For more information on how to set up a KC profile, visit the Knox Configure admin guide. If you are unable to reduce your profile size using the methods above, please submit a support ticket from your Knox dashboard to request a profile limit increase.

sections.title: How to check if the"Prevent applications from being stopped"policy is enforced on an app
sections.content: How to check if the"Prevent applications from being stopped"policy is enforced on an app. If you applied the Prevent applications from being stopped policy to a device in Knox Configure (KC), this knowledge base article shows you how to check if an application is active, or if it is sleeping in Doze mode. This method is especially useful for devices running an Android OS version below 9, as there is no way to verify the application's running state in Settings. Prerequisites This guide assumes you are using a Windows computer with the following installed: 1. ADB Toolkit 2. Google Android USB driver How do I verify if an app is running on my device? To check the running state of an app on your device: 1. Navigate to Settings and enable Max power saving mode. The message "Security policy restricts you from stopping this application" appears. 2. Tap the Recent applications view. If an app appears in the list, the Prevent applications from being stopped policy is applied to it. How do I verify if an app is in sleep/Doze mode with ADB? #On your device: 1. Navigate to Settings > About phone > Software information. 2. Tap Build Number 7 times to enable Developer options. 3. Navigate to the Settings menu again. Under Developer options, enable USB Debugging. #On your computer: 1. Connect the device to your computer via USB. When a prompt appears on the computer asking if you want to allow access to the device's data, click Allow. If this is the first time the device is connected, an additional prompt with the computer's RSA key fingerprint appears. Click OK. 2. On the device, run the application you want to test on the phone. In this example, we are using the Google Chrome app (com.android.chrome). 3. In the Windows Start Menu search bar, type `cmd` and select Windows Command Prompt. #In the command prompt: Change your current directory to where you extracted your ADB files. To do so, paste in the line below and replace the file path: `cd ` Then, run the following ADB command to initiate the ADB connection between device and computer, and simulate the device being unplugged from USB: `adb shell dumpsys battery unplug` Ensure that the app you are testing is running in the background. To get the app's activity status, enter the following ADB command: `adb shell am get-inactive com.android.chrome` `Idle=false` is printed on a new line, indicating that the application is actively running and not in sleep/Doze mode. Run the following ADB command to set the application to sleep or Doze mode: `adb shell am set-inactive com.android.chrome true` Then, run the earlier command to get the status of the app again: `adb shell am get-inactive com.android.chrome` If the result is `Idle=true`, the app was successfully put to sleep. If the result is `Idle=false`, there is a device policy preventing the app from entering sleep/Doze mode. For example, this command prompt window demonstrates what you see if this policy is not enforced on the device: After testing is complete, run the following command to establish the USB connection again: `adb shell dumpsys battery reset`

sections.title: What happens to my Knox Configure license if a device is lost or damaged?
sections.content: What happens to my Knox Configure license if a device is lost or damaged?. If your device is lost or damaged and you want to change the device IMEI associated with your Knox Configure license, you may request a Device IMEI/Serial Number Swap by contacting your local Samsung sales office. You will be asked to provide proof of the IMEI change. For example, you can share an invoice with the device's original IMEI along with an invoice from an authorized service center documenting the repair. After your request's status is approved, the new device's IMEI shows in your Knox Configure console without affecting the license count.

sections.title: Can an app installed through Knox Configure receive updates from Google Play?
sections.content: Can an app installed through Knox Configure receive updates from Google Play?. Yes, apps can receive updates from Google Play as long as the Play Store recognizes the app signature. Ensure the package isn't blocked on the Knox Configure console. To learn how to check your package blocklist, see _Application update restrictions_ in the Knox Configure admin guide. For additional information about app signing, see the Android Developer documentation.

sections.title: How to collect dumpstate logs on wearable devices
sections.content: How to collect dumpstate logs on wearable devices. You might need to help troubleshoot a wearable device issue by getting a log of the device's activities. This knowledge base article guides you through the steps on how to collect these logs. How do I collect dumpstate logs on a wearable device? The easiest way to get these logs from a Samsung wearable device is to use the SysDump tool: 1. Ensure the wearable device is connected to a mobile device via the Galaxy wearable app. 2. On the wearable device, open the device settings. 3. Tap About watch. 4. Scroll down to Serial Number and tap on it five times. 5. On the number pad that appears, enter \*#9900#. 6. Tap Run LOG_DUMP. 7. Once log collection is complete, tap Extract LOG_DUMP. Connect the mobile device to on a Windows PC via USB cable. On the PC: 1. Navigate to the device's internal storage > Pictures > Watch folder. 2. Copy the ZIP file named "log_dump_". You can then send the ZIP file containing the dumpstate logs to Samsung Support. Additional information For steps on how to collect logs on Samsung mobile devices, see How do I capture logs to troubleshoot my mobile device?

sections.title: Can I use DeX mode if certain USB functions are disabled by Knox Configure?
sections.content: Can I use DeX mode if certain USB functions are disabled by Knox Configure?. Depending on the DeX features your deployment requires, certain USB classes can't be disabled. For example, USB host storage must be enabled to use DeX mode. However, you can use DeX mode if other USB capabilities like MTP are disabled. The following are a few common situations you might encounter, and their resolutions: #Use ONLY display port via DeX display port: Enable USB host storage, Don't disable any USB peripherals #Use ONLY USB keyboard and mouse via DeX USB port: Enable USB host storage, Don't disable Human interface device #Use ONLY Ethernet via DeX ethernet port: Enable USB host storage, Don't disable Vendor specific, CDC data, Communications For more about USB restrictions, see USB device restrictions in the Knox Configure admin guide.

sections.title: Device enrolled in Knox Configure not booting correctly
sections.content: Device enrolled in Knox Configure not booting correctly. Some customers are reporting that their Knox Configure (KC)-enrolled device is either not booting, or booting in safe mode. Cause This boot issue typically occurs because critical system apps are blocklisted in your KC profile. These apps are required for the device to function correctly. A common cause is including the package com.android.settings in your blocklist. If you want to restrict Settings access for your users, see Restrictions > Prevent end users from accessing the settings menu in the KC admin guide for the proper steps. Resolution Please check your specified blocklist in the profile the device is enrolled in. For steps on how to do this, see Applications & content in the KC admin guide. If you identify that a system app is causing the issue, please remove the package from the blocklist and factory reset any affected devices to apply the change.

sections.title: Cannot push profile to a device with "Profile assigned" status in Knox Configure
sections.content: Cannot push profile to a device with "Profile assigned" status in Knox Configure. If you assign a Knox Configure (KC) profile to a device after it has completed device setup, enrollment does not automatically start. This article guides you through a few ways to manually trigger KC enrollment, for both first-time enrollment and devices that were previously enrolled in KC. First-time enrollment For devices enrolling in KC for the first time: 1. On the device, launch your internet browser of choice. 2. Navigate to http://configure.samsungknox.com. 3. Tap FIRST-TIME ENROLLMENT. 4. Factory reset the device. After the device is factory reset, ensure that you connect to a network during the setup process. KC enrollment automatically begins after setup is complete. From the Knox Configure console If your device was previously enrolled in KC: 1. Connect your device to a network. 2. Navigate to the device settings > About Device > Software Info > Knox Configure > Apply latest profile. After selecting Apply latest profile, KC enrollment triggers.

sections.title: Profile and device country do not match in Knox Configure
sections.content: Profile and device country do not match in Knox Configure. You may encounter an error during Knox Configure (KC) enrollment where the profile and device countries do not match. Cause Currently, there are two Knox Mobile Enrollment (KME) servers globally in the US and EU, as well as three KC servers globally in the US, EU and China. One server is dedicated to devices in the Americas, while the second server is for devices in the EU and the rest of the world. The servers are hosted through Amazon Web Services (AWS) in the US (for North/Central/South America and the Caribbean), and in Ireland (for all countries except for China and the Americas). Based on the country you select during Samsung Knox registration, your KME/KC Admin account is linked to the appropriate server. For example, if you selected US as your country during KC/KME registration, then only devices from the Americas can be enrolled through this account. Resolution To enroll EU or other global devices, you must create a second KC/KME admin account at SamsungKnox.com and select the corresponding country. You must have two licenses to enroll devices in both US and EU consoles.

sections.title: Cannot download Galaxy Themes on Knox Configure device
sections.content: Cannot download Galaxy Themes on Knox Configure device. You may encounter an issue where you cannot download Galaxy Themes on your device managed in Knox Configure (KC), even if you have added the Galaxy Themes app to your allowlist. Cause If you allow an app in KC, all other apps are automatically blocked. In the Galaxy Themes app, each wallpaper has its own package name. Resolution Allow the wallpaper package name for each theme you want to install.

sections.title: How to set a custom icon for a browser bookmark using Knox Configure
sections.content: How to set a custom icon for a browser bookmark using Knox Configure. This article guides you through the steps on how to set a custom icon for a browser bookmark in Knox Configure (KC), to be displayed on your device's home screen. How do I set a custom icon for a browser bookmark using Knox Configure? To do this, you must have already added web bookmark(s) to the KC profile. You can add web bookmark(s) by navigating to Profile > Application & Content > Samsung Internet Browser Settings > Add web bookmarks. Once a web bookmark has been added, navigate to Profile > Home & Lock screen > Device screen preview. Once you click on a "+" icon on the device screen grid, select "Bookmark" as the Type and you will then be able to add an icon for the bookmark. Additional information For more information, please see the KC admin guide.

sections.title: Device shows battery life over 85% with Knox Configure's "Extend battery life" policy applied
sections.content: Device shows battery life over 85% with Knox Configure's "Extend battery life" policy applied. On a Knox Configure (KC)-managed device with the Extend battery life by limiting the maximum charge when connected to a power source policy enabled, you may notice that the device still charges to 100% despite the policy setting the maximum charge level to 85%. Cause Extend battery life by limiting the maximum charge when connected to a power source protects your battery by preventing the LDU terminal from swelling when constantly plugged in to a power source. With this policy, the charging voltage level is lowered from 4.4V to 4.2V. As the terminal recognizes that the device is fully charged, even though the voltage level was lowered, the battery percentage still shows as 100% when it reaches the 85% charge limit. How can I check if the Extend battery life policy is successfully applied on a device? After applying a KC profile with Extend battery life by limiting the maximum charge when connected to a power source enabled, you can check the Protect battery setting on your device. To do so, go to Settings > Device care > Battery > Charging > Protect battery.

sections.title: An error occurred with setSealedHomeActivity: applicationPackageName in your profile
sections.content: An error occurred with setSealedHomeActivity: applicationPackageName in your profile. The device logs in your KC console specifies the error message: `Error 51010: An error occurred with setSealedHomeActivity: applicationPackageName in your profile. Check the configuration items in your profile and retry.` Cause A Google Play app cannot be assigned as the ProKiosk home activity, as it cannot be installed before the home activity is launched. Resolution Set the KC ProKiosk home activity to one of the following: An APK file uploaded to KC and added to the ProKiosk profile, A pre-installed device app Additional information For more information about Kiosk mode, please see the KC admin guide.

sections.title: How to disable Google Voice Assistant with Knox Configure
sections.content: How to disable Google Voice Assistant with Knox Configure. The Google voice assistant is included in 2 applications: 1. Google voice assistant 2. Google quick search To completely remove Google voice assistant from activating on your device, you will need to disable both packages. See below for the complete steps. If the Google quick search is not disabled, the device user will be able use the Google voice assistant by long pressing the home button and activating the Google quick search. Resolution 1. Navigate to your KC console and select or create a new profile. 2. On the Applications & content page, under Disable the usage of other applications, add the following packages: com.google.android.apps.googleassistant , com.google.android.googlequicksearchbox Additional information To learn more about KC profile features, please see the KC guide.

sections.title: An error occurred with addAppPackageNameToWhitelist: com.samsung.android.knox.kpu and com.sds.emm.cloud.knox.samsung
sections.content: An error occurred with addAppPackageNameToWhitelist: com.samsung.android.knox.kpu and com.sds.emm.cloud.knox.samsung. Some administrators are encountering a 51010 error if they apply the following KC feature, Installation allowlist and enrolling the device in KM. The device logs in your KC console specifies the error message: `Error 51010: An error occurred with addAppPackageNameToWhitelist: com.samsung.android.knox.kpu in your profile. Check the configuration items in your profile and retry.` `Error 51010: An error occurred with addAppPackageNameToWhitelist: com.sds.emm.cloud.knox.samsung in your profile. Check the configuration items in your profile and retry.` Cause The application package names are not specified in the installation allowlist for: Knox Service Plugin, Samsung Knox Manage When applying the installation allowlist in Knox Configure, it automatically blocks all installation attempts from apps that are not included on the whitelist. Resolution To solve the problem, add the following package name under installation allowlist: com.samsung.android.knox.kpu, com.sds.emm.cloud.knox.samsung Push the updated profile to the devices and try the enrollment again.

sections.title: How to use the Activate Knox License Feature
sections.content: How to use the Activate Knox License Feature. This KBA will go over how to use the Activate Knox License feature in KC when uploading your own application. How do I add an application to KC and add a license key to be activated for the app upon enrollment? The steps below can also be performed when creating a profile in the Applications and widgets step. 1. In the KC console, navigate to the Library page from the left hand side panel. For _KC China_ users this page is called Applications. 2. Under the Mobile Apps tab, select Add Mobile application. 3. Select Upload Application. 4. Select Browse and choose the APK you want to upload. 5. Select the checkbox Activate Knox license. 6. If you haven't added a valid license key (see the below section for more information about valid license keys) to the license page of KC yet, select Add a new license. Otherwise, just choose your key from the dropdown menu. 7. Once done, select Upload to save. 8. In the library page, you should see the application you uploaded. In the corner of that application, there is a License tag. Applications uploaded without using the Activate Knox license will not have this tag. If you have uploaded an application without adding a license but wish to add a license, you will need to delete the application and re-upload the package following steps 1-7. 9. If you click on your application, you can see details about the application and also change the license key. 10. Assign a device to a KC profile that includes this newly added application. 11. During enrollment, in the "downloading apps" process, you should see a toast message that reads "Knox license validation completed successfully." Valid License Keys As noted in the tooltip of this feature, only custom SDK license SKUs are supported. Custom SDK licenses have been deprecated, but if you still have a valid custom SDK license, you can still utilize this feature. See more about Knox SDK Licenses. 4004 error When adding a license key to the Activate Knox license section, some users have reported getting a 4004 error. This error indicates that you have not entered a valid license key. See the above section for what license keys are accepted in this feature. If you have entered a valid license key but continue to experience this issue, please submit a support ticket through your Knox dashboard and specify the license key in question. 30102 error During the enrollment process, some users have reported getting a 30102 error and seeing the toast message: "Failed to validate product key" This error indicates that you have not properly associated your app with the license key in KPP. If you have properly bound your app to your license key in KPP but continue to experience this issue, please submit a support ticket through your Knox dashboard. Please specify the license key and application package name in question.

sections.title: How can I prevent a wearable device from accessing a network connection through companion mode?
sections.content: How can I prevent a wearable device from accessing a network connection through companion mode?. Companion mode overrides the watch's Wi-Fi configurations and always on policies set by the IT admin, since it automatically follows the mobile device's access point (AP) and network connection settings. To ensure that the wearable device maintains its Wi-Fi configurations and always on policies, disable Bluetooth to block companion mode.

sections.title: My customer doesn't have a Knox Configure Customer ID. Can I submit their device information?
sections.content: My customer doesn't have a Knox Configure Customer ID. Can I submit their device information?. Before you can register their devices, the customer must first sign up for Knox Configure or Knox Mobile Enrollment first, and then share their Knox Customer ID with you. To learn how to sign up, see Sign up for Knox Configure.

sections.title: How do I fix "signing failed" errors?
sections.content: How do I fix "signing failed" errors?. There are many common causes for "signing failed" error messages, including: Using an undefined privilege, Broken files, Using an accessory protocol, Using an SDK default key. Doing so can result in a "signing failed" error message. A Samsung certificate registered to the Knox Configure portal must be used to sign the app. For more details, see Getting Certificates in the Galaxy Watch for Tizen documentation. See Device-side errors for additional details on error codes and error messages.

sections.title: The WKC agent doesn't automatically update my wearable device after a push update
sections.content: The WKC agent doesn't automatically update my wearable device after a push update. Sometimes, the WKC agent doesn't automatically update the wearable device when a push update is sent. This can occur when a failing app is assigned to the profile. Resolution To troubleshoot this issue, begin by viewing the device log for error details: 1. Go to Devices, then open the DEVICES tab. 2. Check the status of the target device to identify if the device failed to receive the push update. 3. Select the target device. 4. Click ACTION > View device log to identify the app or setting that may have caused the error. Refer to the Knox Configure for Wearables Admin guide for additional guidance on configuration errors. Once you've identified the app or setting that caused the error: 1. Go to Devices, then open the DEVICES tab. 2. Click the target device's assigned profile. From the Profile configuration dashboard: 1. Click APPLICATIONS or DEVICE SETTINGS to remove any settings or app from the profile which may have triggered the failure to update. 2. Update the profile with a valid app. 3. Push the update again. Additional information , Device states in the Knox Configure for Wearables Admin guide, Troubleshooting device-side configuration errors in the Knox Configure for Wearables Admin guide

sections.title: If a KC license expires and is then reactivated, the assigned and activated seats displayed within the KC console are not accurate
sections.content: If a KC license expires and is then reactivated, the assigned and activated seats displayed within the KC console are not accurate. When a license expires, devices are automatically unassigned from their profiles. If a customer renews the license, the "Assigned Seats" and "Activated Seats" numbers are not updated, so the seat numbers prior to license expiration are shown. If the allotted seat count was previously used up, the customer will be unable to assign devices back to the license. Cause The KC database and license database license counts are out of sync. Resolution The KC backend team is currently working on a fix for this issue. Customer action Please raise a ticket in Salesforce from within your Samsung Knox dashboard. To ensure your issue is promptly processed, include the following with your information: Title: Renewed KC license seat count issue Description: KC Customer ID: License Key:

sections.title: Screen timeout set in Knox Configure is not shown in device settings
sections.content: Screen timeout set in Knox Configure is not shown in device settings. If a device user attempts to set the screen timeout setting using the Settings > Display > Screen timeout console navigation path, the maximum length of time selectable is either 10 minutes or 30 minutes, depending on whether the device has an AMOLED or non-AMOLED display. Using KC, administrators can set the device screen timeout to a value greater than 10 minutes. Even if the timeout setting is applied successfully, when the device is restarted and the user navigates to Settings > Display > Screen timeout, the maximum screen timeout is displayed instead. Cause The screen timeout value has actually been applied successfully, but the console's Settings menu limits the length of time before a device screen turns off. For AMOLED displays, the maximum screen timeout is 600 seconds. For non-AMOLED displays, the maximum screen timeout is 1800 seconds. However, a KC administrator can override this UI limitation and set the screen timeout to any value between 5 to 1000 seconds. If this value exceeds the limit as defined above, the UI will display the maximum screen timeout value instead. Resolution This is expected behavior. The device screen will time out based on the value set in KC, not the maximum screen timeout of either 10 or 30 minutes displayed on the device. Additional Information For additional information on how the screen timeout is handled, refer to the Knox SDK documentation).

sections.title: How to change configured devices to a different license key in Knox Configure
sections.content: How to change configured devices to a different license key in Knox Configure. Overview This article guides you through the steps on how to switch a KC-configured device to a different license (e.g. a trial license) without unassigning the device. If the old license is about to expire, these steps must be performed before the license expiry date. When a KC"license (trial or commercial) expires, there is a 30 day grace period to accommodate license renewal delays, after which any devices associated with the license are automatically unassigned from the profile"they were configured to. If the same license key is renewed, there is no action required and you can continue to use the key as normal. You may also replace it with a new key within 30 days to avoid KC unassigning your devices. If a device is no longer in the "configured" state, KC cannot push profile updates or any other changes to the device. The device must manually trigger KC for any profile changes to be applied. There are three ways to do this: 1. From a browser on the device, navigate to configure.samsungknox.com, then select Re-enroll. 2. Navigate to the device settings > About Device > Software Info > Knox Configure > Apply latest profile. 3. Factory reset the device. If a device is automatically unassigned from KC, it remains configured to the profile unless the device user performs any of the 3 actions above. If the device is in the "Unassigned" state when the device user performs one of the 3 actions, then the device will be unconfigured. How do I change all my configured devices to a different license? Follow the steps below if you are: Switching all devices from a trial license to a commercial license, Switching all devices from a commercial license to a different commercial license 1. ​In the KC console, under Licenses, select the old license you wish to replace. 2. Select the Actions dropdown and select Replace License. 3. Select the new license as instructed on the following page, then"click Done. All devices previously assigned to the old license are now assigned to the new license key. How do I change only a select few devices to a different license? Follow the steps below if you are switching one device to a different license key: 1. In the KC console, under Licenses > Enter license key, add the new license key to the license tab. 2. Select the profile name you would like the devices to be configured to. If you are configuring the device to the same profile it is already configured to, you will need to clone the profile. Currently, it is not possible to change licenses within the same profile. To clone a profile, navigate to Profiles > Select the checkbox beside the profile name you would like to clone > Actions > Clone to edit. 3. Under Devices > select the Device ID of the device you wish to edit. 4. In the device details panel, select Edit. 5. In the Profile dropdown, either select the cloned profile created in Step 2 or a new profile you wish to apply to the device. 6. In the License dropdown, select the new license you wish to switch to. 7. Click Save. If you use this method, the device user is required to accept and apply the latest profile once the changes have been saved. They may also choose to postpone the update. If you want to push the update without user consent, please see the steps below. Follow the steps below if you are switching one or multiple devices to a different license key: 1. In the KC console, under Licenses > Enter license key, add the new license key to the license tab. 2. Select the profile name you would like the devices to be configured to. If you are configuring the device to the same profile it is already configured to, you will need to clone the profile. Currently, it is not possible to change licenses within the same profile. To clone a profile, navigate to Profiles > Select the checkbox beside the profile name you would like to clone > Actions > Clone to edit. 3. Select the devices tile > Actions > Assign devices. 4. Select the devices you want to assign. If you cannot find the device, ensure you are not filtering the devices by status. To clear the filter, select Status > Clear status. 5. Select Assign once all the devices you want to assign are selected. 6. Select No when a pop-up appears asking if you want to continue using the existing license. If you would like the devices to automatically receive the changes you are making, select Push update without requesting end-user consent. 7. Select the new license that you would like the devices to use, then click Submit. How do I renew my Knox Configure commercial license? To renew your KC commercial license, contact your KC license reseller. As a best practice, we recommend that you renew your commercial license instead of requesting a new one. If you renew your license, you can continue to use the same one, avoiding the steps associated with switching to a new license.

sections.title: If a trial license expires before it's upgraded, how can I apply a commercial license?
sections.content: If a trial license expires before it's upgraded, how can I apply a commercial license?. If a trial license has expired, you must assign devices with a new valid license. After you assign devices in the Knox Configure console, on the device the user must go to Settings > About phone > Software info > Knox Configure > Apply latest profile to trigger re-enrollment in Knox Configure. Additionally, devices can be re-enrolled after a factory reset or at configure.samsungknox.com.

sections.title: Knox Configure compatibility with Samsung devices
sections.content: Knox Configure compatibility with Samsung devices. Full KC features are supported on Secured by Knox devices, while few features are not available for Android, Others devices.
